p: Open Reeborg's Diary and close Reeborg's world. Then, run the following program.

random() and floor() are two methods from the Javascript Math object. random() generates a random number between 0 and 1; by random we mean a number that can not be predicted and will be different every time the method is called.
floor() takes an arbitrary number and removes the decimal part leaving only an integer (or whole number).

By multiplying the output of random() by 100, and taking the floor, we end up with an integer between 0 and 99. We can use this to design a game that has a player guess a number between 0 and 99 (or whatever arbitrary value we may wish). Actually, other than programmers, people usually start counting at 1 instead of 0, so we can add 1 to the above, Math.floor(Math.random()*100) + 1, in order to get an arbitrary number between 1 and 100 inclusively.
